children.subject: Unless you have a lot of researchy ML experience, it would be hard for you to find a purely ML internship. What I mean to say is, most ML internships that would be available to you would be a lot of data crunching and data cleaning, with just a little bit of ML or deep learning sprinkled on top. Even if you have that researchy experience it can still be hard to find a purely ML internship since most of those are available to masters + PhD students. If you know for a fact you don't like low level/systems programming, then postpone 61c. But if you've never tried it before, I would recommend taking 61c sooner rather than later so that you get a feeling of system programming before you finalize your decision to follow the ML path. At the moment, your fall semester looks a little busy and each of those techs are individually more difficult than any of the techs you've taken so far (maybe with the exception of 188). If you're serious about doing a summer internship, I would recommend lightening your fall semester a little bit so that you have the opportunity to push harder on recruiting

I think doing CS 61C does open my eyes to some parallelism topics that are important in the study of faster computation methods that happens in Machine Learning, specifically Scientific Computing

Do you need to take CS 61C to know about this? No, not really (pretty much black-boxed by PyTorch or Tensorflow), but I am curious on finding out how it works

However, Professors like Dawn Song and David Wagner has research using Machine Learning and Security, and ask for CS 61C

history.content:
Hello, I’m a rising EECS sophomore who will have completed the following courses by fall: 
CS 61AB, EECS 16AB, CS 70, Data 8, Data 100.  After taking Data 100, I think I’m pretty interested in ML and statistics models, and I’m planning to do a simultaneous degree in Data Science, graduate in three years and do the 4th year EECS MS program. 
My fall schedule is 170, 188, 126 and 127. 
So far, I don’t find myself very interested in lower-level programming or system classes, so I’m considering postponing 61C to fall of my third and last year and taking more ML and statistics classes in the upcoming school year (my second year). Is this a bad idea? any advice on finding ML/Data Science internships (preferably not systems-related SWE) in sophomore summer?
history.subject: When to take 61C?
